intro: Tetrataenium sublineare, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tetrataenium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and compound leaves with a distinctive, narrow shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Tetrataenium sublineare is primarily valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
